channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8309067] gtest/AsyncLogGtest.java fails again in stderrOutput_vm
item.description:
Failure mode appears the same as JDK-8297302 but in the stderr test. See on Linux aarch64.

[ RUN ] AsyncLogTest.stderrOutput_vm
open/test/hotspot/gtest/logging/test_asynclog.cpp:292: Failure
Value of: file_contains_substring(TestLogFileName, "LogStreamWithAsyncLogImpl")
  Actual: false
Expected: true
open/test/hotspot/gtest/logging/test_asynclog.cpp:293: Failure
Value of: file_contains_substring(TestLogFileName, "logStream msg1-msg2-msg3")
  Actual: false
Expected: true
open/test/hotspot/gtest/logging/test_asynclog.cpp:294: Failure
Value of: file_contains_substring(TestLogFileName, "logStream newline")
  Actual: false
Expected: true
[ FAILED ] AsyncLogTest.stderrOutput_vm (0 ms)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Fix request [21u]

I backport this for parity with 21.0.5-oracle.
No risk, only a test change.
add added codes are clean, except line different.
SAP nightly testing passed.

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u-dev/pull/923
Date: 2024-08-15 06:18:52 +0000

Changeset: d1af748a
Author: Xin Liu <xliu@openjdk.org>
Date: 2023-11-22 03:23:45 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/d1af748ab470e1068d03a8f8bc1a7445eff721fa

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/16728
Date: 2023-11-20 08:27:49 +0000

I made a testcase to reproducible this. as long as N is big enough >= 10000, it's easy to trigger this error.


make test TEST="jtreg:gtest/AsyncLogGtest.java" CONF=linux-x86_64-server-fastdebug
[ RUN ] AsyncLogTest.bufferUpdater_vm
/home/xxinliu/Devel/jdk/test/hotspot/gtest/logging/test_asynclog.cpp:343: Failure
Value of: file_contains_substrings_in_order(TestLogFileName, lines)
  Actual: false
Expected: true

[ FAILED ] AsyncLogTest.bufferUpdater_vm (334 ms)
[----------] 7 tests from AsyncLogTest (551 ms total)

[----------] Global test environment tear-down
[==========] 7 tests from 1 test suite ran. (551 ms total)
[ PASSED ] 6 tests.
[ FAILED ] 1 test, listed below:

ERROR: RUN_ALL_TESTS() failed. Error 1

[2023-11-20T00:30:19.406692198Z] Waiting for completion for process 57644
[2023-11-20T00:30:19.406868200Z] Waiting for completion finished for process 57644
STDERR:
java.lang.AssertionError: gtest execution failed; exit code = 2. the failed tests: [AsyncLogTest::bufferUpdater_vm]
        at GTestWrapper.main(GTestWrapper.java:98)
        at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DirectMethodHandleAccessor.invoke(DirectMethodHandleAccessor.java:103)
        at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:580)
        at com.sun.javatest.regtest.agent.MainActionHelper$AgentVMRunnable.run(MainActionHelper.java:333)
        at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1570)

JavaTest Message: Test threw exception: java.lang.AssertionError
JavaTest Message: shutting down test


TEST RESULT: Failed. Execution failed: `main' threw exception: java.lang.AssertionError: gtest execution failed; exit code = 2. the failed tests: [AsyncLogTest::bufferUpdater_vm]
--------------------------------------------------
Test results: failed: 1
Report written to /local/home/xxinliu/Devel/jdk/build/linux-x86_64-server-fastdebug/test-results/jtreg_test_hotspot_jtreg_gtest_AsyncLogGtest_java/html/report.html
Results written to /local/home/xxinliu/Devel/jdk/build/linux-x86_64-server-fastdebug/test-support/jtreg_test_hotspot_jtreg_gtest_AsyncLogGtest_java
Error: Some tests failed or other problems occurred.
Finished running test 'jtreg:test/hotspot/jtreg/gtest/AsyncLogGtest.java'
Test report is stored in build/linux-x86_64-server-fastdebug/test-results/jtreg_test_hotspot_jtreg_gtest_AsyncLogGtest_java

==============================
Test summary
==============================
   TEST TOTAL PASS FAIL ERROR
>> jtreg:test/hotspot/jtreg/gtest/AsyncLogGtest.java 1 0 1 0 <<
==============================
TEST FAILURE

make[1]: *** [main] Error 1
make: *** [test] Error 2

I believe I understand the rootcause of this.
AsyncLogWriter::write() has no lock-protection. its job is to write out this->_buffer_staging to disk.

BufferUpdater::BufferUpdater(size_t newsize) is abuser. it updates by force.
  _instance->_buffer_staging = new Buffer(newsize);

the race condition is that AsyncLogWriter::write() has seen the change of BufferUpdater(). as a result, it emits nothing.

next time when it wakes up from _lock.wait(0/* no timeout */), it then reset staging_buffer. as a result, we miss the contents in _buffer_staging.

Here's a log file snippet from the jdk-22+25-1950-tier6 sighting:

gtest/AsyncLogGtest.java

[~xliu] we have not seen a failure since the one reported on Nov 6th . So that was a few days before JDK-8319554 integrated, so we can't conclude anything about that fix as yet.

hi, @dholmes
Does error still occur after we merged JDK-8319554?

> 1) are they all linux-aarch64?

[~xliu] no it is Linux-x64 as well

> 2) Do they always fail in line 292? the same tests apply to both stdout and stderr. if it only hit on stderr, that's a big lead.

No it is a mix of stdout and stderr, but mostly stdout

another possibility is that the test failed to reconfigure 'stderr' in the first place.
set_log_config("stderr", "logging=debug") returns a boolean flag to indicate whether it succeeded. I found that we ignore it.
I create a new task for it. JDK-8319554

hi, @dholmes,
I start investigating this issue. CI captured 16 times in past 6 months?
can we toke a closer look at them?
1) are they all linux-aarch64?

2) Do they always fail in line 292? the same tests apply to both stdout and stderr. if it only hit on stderr, that's a big lead.
[ RUN ] AsyncLogTest.stderrOutput_vm
open/test/hotspot/gtest/logging/test_asynclog.cpp:292: Failure

If it also failed at different places, could you paste them?
Raising priority to P3. We continue to see this fail in our CI testing - now 16 times since original report.

if unexpected results are seen at 292, it means 290 write_to_file and 291 are both true.

290 if (write_to_file(testing::internal::GetCapturedStderr())) {
291 EXPECT_TRUE(file_contains_substring(TestLogFileName, "header"));
292 EXPECT_TRUE(file_contains_substring(TestLogFileName, "LogStreamWithAsyncLogImpl"));
293 EXPECT_TRUE(file_contains_substring(TestLogFileName, "logStream msg1-msg2-msg3"));
294 EXPECT_TRUE(file_contains_substring(TestLogFileName, "logStream newline"));

we capture stderr but only see "header". missing 3 log lines via UL.

Is that we only see this error on stderr or the datapoints we collected are so few that they only manifest on stderr?

UL writes streams in universal way. if we only encounter this problem on stdout/stder, I feel like this problem happens on gtest
esting::internal::GetCapturedStderr().

LogFileStreamOutput
  LogStdoutOutput
  LogStderrOutput
 

I don't have a great way to pinpoint this problem. how about we just remove async logging test for stdout/stderr?

looking into this issue.

the patch of JDK-8297302 applies to both stdout and stderr.
If it's still happening, it suggests that we haven't identified the root-cause.
ILW = MLM = P4
